Audio Description: This black and white poster about war production has tow drawings. In the upper left corner is a drawing of a factory with three smokestack belching out white smoke. In the center of the poster is the outline of the United States. Within the outline is a large tank with lines extending from it in all directions. At the far end of each line is a drawing of a factory. “Making America strong” is written at the top of the poster in large white letters outlined in black. The rest of the text reads, “How subcontracting accelerates defense production, 700 firms in 130 cites in 20 states are helping one corporation to make tanks.”
Creator: National Association of Manufacturers (U. S.)
Description: One of a series of posters  created as "A service to schools, provided as a part of the Public Information Program of the National Association of Manufacturers."
